channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipped mattresses and rubbish., 14th July
item.description:
Opposite 2 Delafield Road. I reported these flytipped mattresses on 20/06/2025 and they are still here on the footpath but my report has been closed with no contact. Please may you arrange for these to be removed as soon as possible? Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Delafield Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Shopping trolley left in Victoria Road Erith outside Christchurch, 14th July
item.description:
A shopping trolley has been left outside Christchurch in Victoria Road. It contains a black bag of rubbish and other rubbish inside the trolley. Can you please remove it before it is used as a rubbish bin. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victoria Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Do your job please this is council property, 14th July
item.description:
You previously closed a request claiming this was a private road. If you had actually looked at the overgrown plant you would have found this is the council road, before the gates of the private road. The plant has a history of overgrowing every year despite claims it has been treated to poison it. Could you please investigate appropriately and not just dismiss the report as previously.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kelsey Park Avenue, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Boxes still left on corner of 1 Salisbury Close SE171BY, 14th July
item.description:
Hi there, we reported this issue on 9 July and it was marked as fixed on 10 July but the boxes were not removed. We re-reported on 13 July, and again it was marked as fixed on 14 July but the boxes have not been removed. The boxes are still on the corner and it is encouraging others to dump rubbish in the same place. Thanks in advance for your help

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-6, Salisbury Close, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
